Widget Integration:
Widgets are our building blocks: these small integrations can be easily added to your website and connect directly with the calendar and products in our system. This means all information, including prices and descriptions, is automatically updated on your website without the need to make changes in multiple places. It’s a simple copy-and-paste of code into your website. We’ll assist you with the implementation, but it’s very straightforward.
Onboarding timeframe: 4-8 weeks depending on the competency and dedication from the customer
Continuing Support: Dedicated Account Manager, Helpdesk, Knowledgebase, Printed/PDF support guides

Website Documentation:
The PatronBase CRM and ticketing system has an online sales module that enables customers to purchase tickets in real-time including pick your own seat (if opted). The web module is directly linked to the main database meaning that customers have the ability to access the same 
account information, amend and update it, as if they were contacting the venue directly and for organisations to manage their PatronBase events (and more) online themselves. 

The PatronBase Patron API allows external applications to hook into the patron database and allows them to register and validate patrons.
Onboarding timeframe: For a standard implementation, with no bespoke development required, we recommend the initial implementation phase is planned out over 6-8 weeks.
Continuing Support: Dedicated Account Manager, Helpdesk, Knowledgebase, Printed/PDF support guides

Payment Solution:
We have our own payment platform on Adyen called Priopay. Adyen supports a comprehensive range of payment methods, enabling businesses to cater to diverse customer preferences globally. The supported payment options include:

Credit and Debit Cards: Major card networks such as Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover, Diners Club, JCB, and UnionPay.

Local Payment Methods: Region-specific options like Bancontact in Belgium, iDEAL in the Netherlands, and BLIK in Poland. 
ADYEN

Digital Wallets: Popular wallets including Apple Pay, Google Pay, Samsung Pay, and PayPal.

Bank Transfers: Direct debit and bank transfer services such as SEPA Direct Debit in Europe and ACH Direct Debit in the United States.

Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL): Services like Klarna, Afterpay, and Zip, allowing customers to defer payments.

Cash-Based Methods: Options like Boleto in Brazil and OXXO in Mexico, enabling customers to pay with cash at local stores.

Mobile Payments: Methods such as Alipay, WeChat Pay, and GCash, popular in various regions.
Reporting Sources: Direct/Back Office, GA4 Website Revenue, OTA, Website
